title: 114_s2723
content: The "Congressional Whistleblower Protection Act of 2016" amends the Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 to include rights and protections under whistleblower protection rules for legislative branch employees. The "Congressional Whistleblower Protection Act of 2016" provides rights and protections for legislative branch employees who disclose information about violations of laws, mismanagement, waste of funds, abuse of authority, or dangers to public health and safety. The "Congressional Whistleblower Protection Act of 2016" allows disclosure of information unless prohibited by law or required to be kept secret for national defense or foreign affairs. Disclosure can be made to the General Counsel, Inspector General, or designated employee for reporting violations of laws or mismanagement. The "Congressional Whistleblower Protection Act of 2016" defines violations as gross mismanagement, waste of funds, abuse of authority, or danger to public health or safety. It includes employees of the Government Accountability Office and Library of Congress as covered employees. The remedy for violations is determined as per chapter 12 of the Act. The Board will issue regulations to implement the Congressional Whistleblower Protection Act of 2016, aligning with existing regulations under chapters 12 and 23 of title 5, United States Code, unless modifications are deemed necessary for better implementation of rights and protections. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 will undergo technical and conforming amendments, including changes to the table of contents for part A of title II. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 will undergo technical amendments to part A of title II, including changes to the table of contents. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 will undergo technical amendments related to whistleblower protection rules and prohibition of intimidation or reprisal. Amendments include adding Section 2302(b)(8) of title 5, United States Code, and conforming changes to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
